books.Description: In a dystopian future, the totalitarian nation of Panem is divided into 12 districts and the Capitol. Each year, one boy and one girl from each district are selected by lottery to participate in the Hunger Games, a brutal and televised fight to the death. The story follows 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen, who volunteers to take her younger sister's place in the games.

This poignant novel explores the funny, thrilling, and tragic business of being alive and in love. It tells the story of Hazel Grace Lancaster, a sixteen-year-old cancer patient who is forced by her parents to attend a support group, where she subsequently meets and falls in love with Augustus Waters, an ex-basketball player and amputee.

Set in Nazi Germany, the novel is narrated by Death and follows a young girl named Liesel Meminger who steals books and shares them with her neighbors during bombing raids as well as with the Jewish man hidden in her basement.

This novel is set in a society which at first appears to be a utopian society but is later revealed to be a dystopian one as the story progresses. The story centers on a young boy named Jonas, who is chosen to inherit the position of Receiver of Memory, the person who stores all the past memories of the time before Sameness, a plan that eradicated pain and strife by converting to 'Sameness', a plan that has also eradicated emotional depth from their lives.

Set in the early 1960s in Jackson, Mississippi, the story is about African American maids working in white households. It's a period drama that explores the racial tensions of the time and tells a story of women from both sides of the social divide.
This novel tells the story of two weeks in the life of a 14-year-old boy named Ponyboy Curtis and his struggles with right and wrong in a society in which he believes that he is an outsider.

This fantasy-adventure novel is based on Greek mythology. It follows Percy Jackson, a modern-day teenager who discovers he is a demigod and son of Poseidon. He is sent on a quest to prevent a war among the gods.

Set in 1964, this novel tells the story of Lily Owens, whose life has been shaped around the blurred memory of the afternoon her mother was killed. She escapes her harsh life with her abusive father by running away with her caregiver, Rosaleen, to a town that holds the secret to her mother's past.

The novel follows the life of teenager Miles Halter as he enrolls in boarding school to try to gain a deeper perspective on life. He meets Alaska Young, and his life becomes an adventure of self-discovery and tragedy.

books.Book Title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
books.Description: This coming-of-age novel is a story about what it's like to travel that strange course through the uncharted territory of high school. It's a tale of love, loss, fear, hope and the unforgettable friends that help us through life.

A classic piece of American literature, it is a story of passion, wealth, and tragedy, set against the backdrop of the roaring twenties. The novel follows the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

George Orwell's dystopian novel set in a totalitarian future where a regime controls every aspect of life, even people's thoughts. It tells the story of Winston Smith, a man who begins to question the system and tries to rebel against it.

Set in the 1930s, this novel is renowned for its warmth and humor, despite dealing with serious issues of rape and racial inequality. The story is told through the eyes of Scout Finch, as her father, Atticus Finch, a lawyer, strives to prove the innocence of a black man unjustly accused of rape.

This novel, set in rural England in the early 19th century, follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the witty and intelligent protagonist, and her relationship with Mr. Darcy, a wealthy but reserved gentleman.

J.D. Salinger's novel is a classic coming-of-age story narrated by Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City, who is living in a boarding school and tells the story of his life after being expelled from prep school.

A fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon, Smaug. Bilbo's journey takes him from light-hearted, rural surroundings into more sinister territory.

books.Book Title: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.Description: Anne Frank's diary is a powerful memoir of her life during the Holocaust. While hiding from the Nazis, Anne recorded her experiences and hopes in her diary, offering a unique perspective on one of history's darkest times.

books.Book Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.Description: This is the first novel in the Harry Potter series and introduces Harry Potter, a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday when he receives a letter of acceptance to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

An epic fantasy novel set in the world of Middle-earth, it follows the quest of the Fellowship of the Ring, which includes hobbits, elves, men, and a wizard, to destroy the One Ring before the dark lord Sauron can reclaim it.
Paulo Coelho's masterpiece tells the mystical story of Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure as extravagant as any ever found.

books.Book Title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
books.Description: This fantasy novel for children is the first published and best-known of C.S. Lewis's 'Chronicles of Narnia' series. It's the story of four children who visit the magical land of Narnia through a wardrobe.
Charlotte Brontë's novel is a first-person narrative of the title character, a governess who develops a love for her brooding and mysterious employer, Mr. Rochester.
Aldous Huxley's novel presents an imagined future where life is painless but meaningless. It's a vision of a perfect society shadowed by a dystopian world.
George Orwell's satirical tale is an allegory of the Russian Revolution and the Soviet Union's rise to power. It is a commentary on the corrupting influence of power.
Charles Dickens' novel is set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution. It's a story of love and revolution.

Oscar Wilde's only novel tells of a young man named Dorian Gray, the subject of a painting by artist Basil Hallward. Dorian sells his soul for eternal youth, leading him down a path of immorality and self-destruction.
John Steinbeck's novel is a powerful and deeply affecting narrative of the Joad family's struggle to leave the Dust Bowl of Oklahoma for a better life in California during the Great Depression.

Mark Twain's novel is often recognized as an American classic and is a direct sequel to The Adventures of Tom Sawyer. It is known for its colorful description of people and places along the Mississippi River.
William Golding's novel is about a group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island and their disastrous attempt to govern themselves.

Khaled Hosseini's novel is a story of friendship and betrayal between two boys growing up in Kabul. Set against a backdrop that includes the fall of Afghanistan's monarchy through the Soviet military intervention, the exodus of refugees to Pakistan and the United States, and the rise of the Taliban regime.
